summary: Walter F. Mondale is mentioned in three documents related to the Senate Select Committee on Intelligence Activities (SSC). One document discusses his planned trip to inspect CIA covert intelligence sites in Europe and the concerns it raised with the White House. Another document is a transcript of a SSCIA hearing regarding CIA activities in the Congo and the potential assassination of Patrice Lumumba. The third document focuses on providing information to the U.S. Senate Select Committee (SSC) concerning Martin Luther King, Jr., and Stanley Levison's alleged ties to the Communist Party USA (CPUSA).
key_connections: Senate Select Committee on Intelligence Activities (SSC)
significance: Based on the provided documents, Walter F. Mondale's significance in the JFK assassination context is indirect. He was a Senator involved with the SSC, which investigated intelligence activities, including potential CIA involvement in foreign assassinations. His planned trip to inspect CIA sites suggests an oversight role, but the documents do not directly link him to the JFK assassination.
